Keywords: Codex , Fantastic Four , Monster , S.H.I.E.L.D. , Soldier , Spider-Man Family , Thunderbolts
Real Name: Flash Thompson
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Elevated, Hindering
CIRCLE OF FOUR: If Agent Venom hasn't been moved or placed this turn, modify attack and damage +1.
CALL IN HELP FROM... ME!: Once per turn, when another friendly character that shares a keyword with Agent Venom hits, after resolutions you may roll a d6. 3-6: Place Agent Venom adjacent to a hit opposing character.
SYMBIOTE: Plasticity, Shape Change.
THE VENOMEST: Adjacent friendly characters can use Shape Change.

A Skrull's best friend.
February 24, 2021
Goop
This guys dial is kind of all over the place, an odd mix of range and melee. You can call him in next to your opponent and then i suppose he can running shot away or stay up close. He's good but i would have rather him been more focused on one thing or another. Granting everyone adjacent shape change is where the value is.
September 20, 2020
DatHomieSilverSurfer
Goshdang is this by far the best Agent Venom/Flash sculpt we've gotten. Dynamic, well defined proportions, and just straight up looks most like his comic appearances. I went 3-0 with a circle of 4 team + Earth X ben. All due to Flash being able to get in for a hit whenever I needed him
September 19, 2020
tyroclix
WIN/LOSS: 2-0 This version of Agent Venom, on paper, brings a lot. I really targeted him to get due to his ability to give adjacent allies Shape-Change. Using his Call in Help ability counters his own Circle of Four trait - which is counter-intuitive from a design perspective and reduces value. His biggest issue is he is so potentially dangerous he becomes a big target - and this makes him susceptible to being Outwitted. Many clicks of average combat values allows him to be overwhelmed when targeted. I want to try him again and see what he can do when he dictates match-ups. Still, a decent and interesting piece.
September 14, 2020
AluminumMan
I agree, Spider-Island was one of my favorite Battleworld comics and it would be fitting to have an Agent Venom with that keyword thrown in somewhere.
